OMG just finished #StarTrek Voyager "Virtuoso." The fan mail from Seven to the Doctor. All the feels. Almost more than "Someone to Watch..."
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist @sarahamber Interesting. With book bans? Or reading programs? The "read w/kids" advice & judging?
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze I haven't been commenting on this aspect bc teaching college, there's less parent issues. But it's important, yes.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze I'm ok w/not using deficiency framing, as long as we don't forget that "difference" doesn't mean "no expectations."
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist To find the common ground first rather than say, "You're doing it wrong!" I'm down with that.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze Yes, teachers.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist It's the same folks who think we shld not pursue computer grading of student papers bec lacks "human" element.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist Or science, really. Hence the humanities/science divide. It starts in English class.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist I'm sympathetic to that, but I think it means we need better models. They think it means we don't need models.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist It's the fact that in many cases, the use of quantitative research has built English tests that hurt their students.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist Well coming back to why English teachers are skeptical of research.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist Maybe love of the field, I guess. But that's not what they were referring to. Sorry for lack of context.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist Not all teachers treat their profession as a love story. I care about my students. I don't love them.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist +English studies away from the systematic study of language.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist That's a good question. My traditional response is that the romanticism is a historical evolution driving+
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist This is why I am perhaps more skeptical of teacher knowledge. Bc I'm in humanities.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist That doesn't seem like inquiry. That seems like camp counselor/religious revival rhetoric.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist But on the other hand, the top tweet two years ago for NCTE is "Teaching is a love story."
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze National Council of Teachers of English. It's the US English lang arts prof org and conference.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist But I also know that teachers know things that researchers don't. So it's complicated.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist I'm split on this. On 1 hand, I feel like the emphasis on lore & art in NCTE is what deprofessionalizes the field.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist As long as it doesn't halt applying research, I'm definitely for scientific humility.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist And on what basis do you make the prediction that they might accomplish x if they did y? Research? How is this diff?
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist Can you give an example?
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze That quote from Martin & Rose that I always share in conversations like this. https://t.co/kcWBVXfwp6
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist You just finished your diss. Is it of no practical import?
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist This is frustrating. What is the role of research in policy, then?
@sarahshulist What @NemaVeze tweeted was compelling, but I'm still struggling w/what I read in my literacy classes.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze Yeah I think I'm prolly speaking from ignorance since I didn't see all the rsrch in the panel.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze Guess I need to dig out my Martin & Rose quote on this topic.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze I don't know abt pressure, but I'm not sure there's anything against research-based advice, no? From transfer persp?
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist And virtually any attempt to incorporate elements of non-school cultures cld now be seen as playing on stereotypes.
@NemaVeze @sarahshulist I guess that's the part that I don't understand as a practical matter, when "home" varies so much.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze Nah, my tone is antagonistic. I was kinda subtweeting. It's fair.
@sarahshulist @NemaVeze I'm not disagreeing with that. That's a large part of my own pedagogy.
@NemaVeze Radically and fundamentally change school so that each child's school experience is tailored to existing home experience?
@NemaVeze From transfer perspective, this is always the practical reality: mismatch bet school & home creates problems. So what response?
@NemaVeze Or is this just critiquing reading to infants as the one and only way to academic success?
@NemaVeze Or that if you want kid to succeed in academy, reading with them is not something you should consider?
@NemaVeze Reading w/kids IS part of academic success as long as academy values reading. Is author suggesting academy no longer value rdng?
@NemaVeze It kinda is in Halliday. #sysfunc
@joshiddings But if the student does look for meaning, aren't they just doing what the teacher taught them? Doesn't that contradict prev twt

@agentausten09 Anyway, how are you liking it?
@agentausten09 But that was the instruction I received there.
@agentausten09 I was at a wonderful parish in Geist. It seemed to emphasize service to poor--if that counts as "liberal," I dunno.
@agentausten09 Yep, I'm down with that. I went Episcopal bc seemed more consistent w/my views and practice.
@agentausten09 +with all the teachings, but my instructors seemed to indicate that was the deal. Not sure how others wld have advised.
@agentausten09 I didn't want to be a part of something that required that level of agreement. I know many Catholics don't all agree+
@agentausten09 The "agreeing with everything" was actually a problem for me. Since Pope's moral instruction is binding, I felt torn.
@agentausten09 I went to RCIA classes for a bit while I was in Indy. I was raised Catholic, and we left, but it still appeals. Plus Francis.
@agentausten09 Ah, the Italian connection, right?

Arnold Vinick, the fictional GOP senator & Pres. candidate on WW, called it "irresponsible... [to play] games with the debt ceiling."
And I keep thinking about a fictional GOP senator who also fictionally ran for President in the West Wing.
